title: Human (monster)
data:
***Version [0.24](/0.24 "0.24")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*For a list of all humans, see [list of humans](/List_of_humans "List of humans").*

|   | An uppity sort of surface-dwelling, hairless ape. Dwarves think of them as fragile, elves think of them as clumsy, and monsters think of them as tasty.***“Do you know Do I know What’s this thing called ‘man’? God only knows what a man is! I only know his price.” -Bertolt Brecht, “The Measures Taken”. 1930. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
  - [2.1 Variant Humans](#Variant_Humans)
- [3 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Humans** are uncommon creatures in the dungeon and generally aren't very threatening. If you see one, it's either a [shapeshifter](/Shapeshifter_\(monster\) "Shapeshifter (monster)"), a sign of a nearby [vault](/Vault "Vault") (*e.g.*, "[yak](/Yak "Yak") farm" or "sword in the stone"), or an outrider for one of a few [uniques](/Unique_monster "Unique monster").

## Tips & Tricks

Although generally very easy if you meet them, humans can be dangerous if spawned with [crossbows](/Crossbows "Crossbows"), branded weapons, or [tower shields](/Tower_shield "Tower shield"), and they pack a surprisingly strong punch if they meet a low-level character.

### Variant Humans

[![Deformed human.png](/images/4/4d/Deformed_human.png)](/File:Deformed_human.png) You can find **deformed**, **febrile**, or **sickly humans** in some of the sealed chambers in [Cigotuvi's Fleshworks](/Cigotuvi%27s_Fleshworks "Cigotuvi's Fleshworks").

|   |                                                |
| - | ---------------------------------------------- |
|   | A poor creature that looks hideously deformed. |

## History

- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), there were ghosts of **human monks** in [Wucad Mu's Monastery](/Wucad_Mu%27s_Monastery "Wucad Mu's Monastery").
- Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), some vaults could contain **sacrificial humans**, which were regular humans with a custom description.
html:
Human (monster)

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.24: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of all humans, see list of humans.

human p 
HP 21-44
HD 6
XP 196
Speed 10
AC 3
EV 13
Will 20
Attack1 10 (hit: plain)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type human, human
Flags Speaks
Warm-blooded
An uppity sort of surface-dwelling, hairless ape. Dwarves think of them as fragile, elves think of them as clumsy, and monsters think of them as tasty.

“Do you know
Do I know
What’s this thing called ‘man’?
God only knows what a man is!
I only know his price.”
-Bertolt Brecht, “The Measures Taken”. 1930.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Tips & Tricks
    • 2.1 Variant Humans
  • 3 History

Useful Info

Humans are uncommon creatures in the dungeon and generally aren't very threatening. If you see one, it's either a shapeshifter, a sign of a nearby vault (e.g., "yak farm" or "sword in the stone"), or an outrider for one of a few uniques.

Tips & Tricks

Although generally very easy if you meet them, humans can be dangerous if spawned with crossbows, branded weapons, or tower shields, and they pack a surprisingly strong punch if they meet a low-level character.

Variant Humans

You can find deformed, febrile, or sickly humans in some of the sealed chambers in Cigotuvi's Fleshworks.

A poor creature that looks hideously deformed.

History

  • Prior to 0.14, there were ghosts of human monks in Wucad Mu's Monastery.
  • Prior to 0.13, some vaults could contain sacrificial humans, which were regular humans with a custom description.

{{monster info|human}}

==Useful Info==
'''Humans''' are uncommon creatures in the dungeon and generally aren't very threatening. If you see one, it's either a [[shapeshifter (monster)|shapeshifter]], a sign of a nearby [[vault]] (''e.g.'', "[[yak]] farm" or "sword in the stone"), or an outrider for one of a few [[unique monster|unique]]s.  

==Tips & Tricks==
Although generally very easy if you meet them, humans can be dangerous if spawned with [[crossbows]], branded weapons, or [[tower shield]]s, and they pack a surprisingly strong punch if they meet a low-level character.

===Variant Humans===
[[File:Deformed human.png]] You can find '''deformed''', '''febrile''', or '''sickly humans''' in some of the sealed chambers in [[Cigotuvi's Fleshworks]].

{{flavour|A poor creature that looks hideously deformed.}}

==History==
*Prior to [[0.14]], there were ghosts of '''human monks''' in [[Wucad Mu's Monastery]].
*Prior to [[0.13]], some vaults could contain '''sacrificial humans''', which were regular humans with a custom description.

[[Category:Human]]
